definition: capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

sentences.english: I'm not going to flatter myself by assuming these cameras are for me.
sentences.chinese: 我不打算自不量力假設這些相機是專門爲我準備。

sentences.english: When she said she would do the job I think she bit off more than she could chew.
sentences.chinese: 當她說她將要做這份工作時，我想她是自不量力。

sentences.english: Many card holders who don't know their limits get into debts over their heads.
sentences.chinese: 許多持卡人自不量力，讓卡債逼上絕路。

sentences.english: We didn't have enough to get by.
sentences.chinese: 別太自不量力了，你還有很多要學。

definition: not to know the immensity of heaven and earth/an exaggerated opinion of one's own abilities
pinyin: bu4 zhi1 tian1 gao1 di4 hou4

definition: to follow the path to one's own doom (idiom)/to bring about one's own destruction
to be carried away by one's wishful thinking (idiom)/to labor under a delusion/wishful thinking
lit. to strike a stone with egg (idiom); to attempt the impossible/to invite disaster by overreaching oneself
to show no understanding of the times (idiom); cannot adapt to current circumstances/not amenable to reason
a mantis trying to stop a chariot (idiom)/to overrate oneself and attempt sth impossible/also written 螳臂擋車|螳臂挡车[tang2 bi4 dang3 che1]
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
(fig.) to fight a one-sided battle/to have an unfair advantage in a contest
lit. an ant trying to shake a tree/to overrate oneself (idiom)
